page.title: 02COUNTRY CRAFTS - A REVIVAL
page.content: A very wide variety of crafts is practised in this area. The President of Devon Embroiderers' Guild lives at Thorn. Exhibitions are held in Exeter. A founder member of the Quilters' Guild lives and works at Batworthy Mill - the Guild has a membership of 2000 with 100 overseas.There will be an exhibition of work in Exeter in 1986. Work is shown annually at Moretonhampstead Craft Fair. Spinning takes place at Lower Jurston,Thorn and Buda, also weaving and pottery at Buda. There is a Honiton lace-maker at Quintatown who teaches locally. Thatching is much in demand in this area and a young thatcher lives at Lower Horselake. A doll and puppet maker lives at Stinhall. It has been suggested there is scope for a Craft Centre in the area either in Chagford or at Batworthy.
